Reasoning: **Right, let's break this down. Ante 3, Round 6, aiming for 4,000 chips. The Boss blind reduces my hand size by 1. Base hand size is 8 + 3 from Turtle Bean - 1 from the Boss = 10 cards. I have 4 hands and discards left. Current chips are zero.**

**I've got a decent set of Jokers: Odd Todd, Abstract Joker, Turtle Bean, The Tribe, and Gift Card. I have one consumable, "The Hanged Man," which destroys up to 2 cards. Also have a Telescope Voucher, but that's for later.**

**Looking at my hand, I have a potential Flush in Spades: Ace, King, Queen, 10, 8, 3, and 2.  I can play any five. I should also note that Odd Todd gives chips for odd-ranked cards, and Abstract Joker gives a multiplier per Joker. The Tribe doubles the multiplier if I have a Flush. Gift card increases sell value at the end of the round.**

**My first instinct is to find the best hand. I can get some major points from the flush - Base is 65 chips, 8 mult, but this could be multiplied by two from the Tribe. Odd Todd will provide bonuses as well. I'm going to run the calculations for two Flush options, the first is High card Spades (A, K, Q, 10, 8), and the second is mostly Odd cards (A, 3, 8, 10, Q). After running the numbers, the second choice will yield the most chips.**

**I should use "The Hanged Man" now to thin the deck. I'm thinking of destroying the King of Hearts and 8 of Hearts. They are not Spades and their even ranks are bad for Odd Todd. Removing those cards increases the chance of drawing more Spades in subsequent hands. I should go ahead and do this because this flush will take me over the goal of 4000 chips.  Using "The Hanged Man" now also means I can use the Gift Card on a later consumable, if I ever get another one.**

**So, the action is to use the consumable (Hanged Man) and target those two cards. I'm also going to check, should I re-arrange Jokers? I want my chips, multi and times mult order.**

**I'm looking back over my actions. There is no reason to discard at this point. I have 7 spades in my hand and can make a flush out of that hand. A, 3 are odd. K, Q, 10, 8, 2 are even. I will play (A, 3, K, Q, 10). I should get the two Odd Todd triggers.**

**The JSON should be pretty simple: "action":"use\_consumable", and the positions array which should be \[1, 8, 9] (consumable index and the two cards).**

**The JSON should be a single line, valid JSON without extra text.**

**I've double-checked all the indices, and it looks good. Let's send it.**

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**Balatro Decision: Ectoplasm over Immolate**

Okay, here's the deal. I'm at Ante 4, Round 6, Spectral Pack time. I've got $16 in the bank, five jokers (full house!), and no consumables. The Spectral Pack gives me a tough choice: Ectoplasm or Immolate. Ectoplasm gives a new joker slot but -1 hand size. Immolate gives $20 and deck thinning but randomly destroys 5 cards.

My Jokers are: Odd Todd (replaceable), Abstract (good for now), Turtle Bean (temporary hand size boost, but decaying), The Tribe (x2 Flush mult, absolutely vital), and Gift Card (scaling sell value).

My strategy is flushes, so thinning the deck is generally good, and The Tribe is my key. I am currently running a good hand with 10 cards.

Originally I was leaning towards Immolate for the cash injection, but then I remember Ectoplasm is rarer. But looking at the hand I'm holding, 3 Spades. Immolate could destroy my Spades, which I need for Flushes!

The Ectoplasm choice gives me a sixth joker slot. Yes, -1 hand size is painful, but the extra joker slot is usually the "win condition" move in high-ante runs of Balatro. And I can live with the hit. Turtle Bean is at +2 hand size right now, decaying, so I'll be at a net of 7 with Ectoplasm. Even with my reduced hand size, level 3 Flush and The Tribe will still be scoring.

So, I was ready to go with Immolate for a moment. $20 would take me to $36, but then I remembered that an extra joker is *always* good. I need to make sure I don't need to sell a Joker first. No, Ectoplasm works on existing Jokers. Immolate would give me an influx of cash for rerolls or Celestial packs, but I need that Joker Slot.

Ectoplasm's description says "-1 hand size". It's a permanent reduction. I *think* that last round's boss reduced hand size, but that's over now. So base hand size is 8. Turtle Bean adds +2 for 10. Ectoplasm is the Spectral card, the standard.

I need to confirm the schema one more time! The `select` command for boosters is: `select <pack_card_position>`. So my final decision is Ectoplasm, which is position 1.

The extra Joker slot, and the permanent negative is the win condition. Let's do it!
